channel.title: math.SG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Positive microlocal holonomies are globally regular
item.description: arXiv:2409.07435v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We establish a geometric criterion for local microlocal holonomies to be globally regular on the moduli space of Lagrangian fillings. This local-to-global regularity result holds for arbitrary Legendrian links and it is a key input for the study of cluster structures on such moduli spaces. Specifically, we construct regular functions on derived moduli stacks of sheaves with Legendrian microsupport by studying the Hochschild homology of the associated dg-categories via relative Lagrangian skeleta. In this construction, a key geometric result is that local microlocal merodromies along positive relative cycles in Lagrangian fillings yield global Hochschild 0-cycles for these dg-categories.
item.dc:creator: Roger Casals, Wenyuan Li

item.title: Non-fillability of overtwisted contact manifolds via polyfolds
item.description: arXiv:2011.02249v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We prove that any weakly symplectically fillable contact manifold is tight. Furthermore we verify the strong Weinstein conjecture for contact manifolds that appear as the concave boundary of a directed symplectic cobordism whose positive boundary satisfies the weak-filling condition and is overtwisted. Similar results are obtained in the presence of bordered Legendrian open books whose binding-complement has vanishing second Stiefel-Whitney class. The results are obtained via polyfolds.
item.dc:creator: Wolfgang Schmaltz, Stefan Suhr, Kai Zehmisch

item.title: Deformations of Lagrangian $NQ$-submanifolds
item.description: arXiv:2309.05580v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper we prove graded versions of the Darboux Theorem and Weinstein's Lagrangian tubular neighbourhood Theorem in order to study the deformation theory of Lagrangian $NQ$-submanifolds of degree $n$ symplectic $NQ$-manifolds. Using Weinstein's Lagrangian tubular neighbourhood Theorem, we attach to every Lagrangian $NQ$-submanifold an $L_\infty$-algebra, which controls its deformation theory. The main examples are coisotropic submanifolds of Poisson manifolds and (higher) Dirac structures with support in (higher) Courant algebroids.
item.dc:creator: Miquel Cueca, Jonas Schnitzer
